election_record.label: New York 1821 Constitutional Convention

sub_unit.name: Livingston
sub_unit.note: The Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) reversed the votes in the Town of Livingston, reporting 193 vote Yes and 44 No.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: "Hancock, Tompkins, No Election." Delaware Gazette (Delhi, NY). May 10, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: "Hancock, Tompkins, No Election." Delaware Gazette (Delhi, NY). May 10, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The American lists 119 No votes in Jefferson County, but the town totals add up to 124.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: The American June 5, 1821 lists 306 No votes in Onondaga County, but the town totals add up to 309.

sub_unit.name: Oswego
sub_unit.note: The list of towns in the Annals and Recollections of Oneida County by Pomroy Jones omits the vote count of the towns of Granby, Hannibal and Mexico.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Cherry-Valley Gazette (Cherry Valley, NY) May 8, 1821 lists the No total as 980, but the town totals add up to 985.

sub_unit.name: Thompson
sub_unit.note: The Ulster Plebeian May 9, 1821 lists 153 For Convention votes.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). May 1, 1821.
The New-York Spectator (New York, NY). May 2, 1821.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 3, 1821.
The Columbian, for the Country (New York, NY)). May 4, 1821.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). May 7, 1821.
The American. (For the Country) (New York, NY). June 9, 1821.
Jones, Pomroy. Annals and Recollections of Oneida County. Rome, NY: Published by the Author, 1851. 33.
